title: go.tools/go/types: support allow suppression of " errors
body:
We can distinguish two classes of errors in the type-checker:  (1) "lesser"
errors, for which we can still give an interpretation to an errant program.  For
example, "unused variable" or "cross-package reference to unexported
identifier", and 

Many tools will want to type-check arbitrary expressions, sometimes containing
"lesser"
